MODS:titleInfo.MODS:title: CARDINAL KEY: (sitting) Jane Ryan, Toni Armbruster, Mary Ann Batinich, Tootie Vitter, Mary Nolan, Hope Sewell. (standing) Mary
Photo by Ed Curda Beth Favaloro, Mary Henderson, Anne Higgins, Kathy Springstead, Jane Gisevius, and Pat Peltier.
Students protest decision for SC leaders
Symposium opens Latin America Week; lectures, style show, exhibits included
JOHN GERASSI Ramparts editor to speak
RICHARD RICHARDSON To participate in Latin American symposium
Student Council filings for representatives yield one contested race for president of a college
U.S. faces 'hard choices' calling for change of will
Father Tonnar concerned over mid-semester exams
Religious film to be narrated by Fr. Schauer
Loyola debate team defeats Yeshiva U.
Frank Hercules talks on Negro literary image
Father Clancy to be in history seminar
Fr. C. O'Neill aids work on catalogs
New I.D. pictures will be issued Mon.
Student Council committee to study schools disciplinary action policy
Father Clancy announces history department split
DA's office drops charges on LU students
LU faculty interviews aired on WOLF as 'Education Today, program continues
Church affiliation no longer on transcripts
Admissions director announces freshman class of 356 expected

WHO'S GOT THE BALL?: Wolfpack second baseman Gary Bono leaps home with the first run during the sixth inning of Saturday night's game against the Tigers from LSU. Bono again did the scoring honors in the eighth inning as the Pack downed the Tigers 2-0 at Kirsch-Rooney park.
Men's baseball opens; boxing set for Monday
